alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 18 at 8:12AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...For the Yukon River, from the mouth of the Nowitna River to the mouth of the Koyukuk River. * WHEN...Through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas along the Yukon River is now occurring near the Nowitna River area. Flooding of low lying areas is expected to move downstream today and tonight. Flooding is possible at Galena and the village of Koyukuk later today or tonight. Water could rise rapidly and fish camps and cabins along the Yukon River from the mouth of the Nowitna River to the mouth of the Koyukuk River could become flooded. Ruby is not expected to flood due to its elevation above the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - On Wednesday afternoon, an ice jam was in place on the Yukon River 20 miles upstream of Ruby. There was a 150-mile run of bank-to-bank ice and high water upstream of this jam. Flooding was occurring in the Nowitna River area. At Galena, water is falling, indicating the ice jam is holding water upstream. When the jam releases, a surge of high water and ice will move rapidly downriver that could flood Galena and Koyukuk and low areas in between today or tonight. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River between the Nowitna and Koyukuk Rivers, stay alert and be prepared to take action. Ice jam flooding has high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water and severe flooding. Now is the time to take precautions. Where possible, move valuables to higher ground and prepare to move at a moment`s notice.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
